model_solution:
Step 1: Distribute the $\frac{3}{2}$ to the terms inside the first parentheses, and distribute the $-4$ to the terms inside the second parentheses: $$\left(2x+\frac{3}{2} (4x-6)\right)-4\left( -(2-x)+\frac{x}{2}\right) = \left(2x+6x-9\right)-4\left(-2+x-\frac{x}{2}\right)$$
Step 2: Simplify the expression inside the second parentheses by distributing the $-4$ and combining like terms, and also combine like terms in the expression inside the first parentheses: $$\left(2x+6x-9\right)-4\left(-2+x-\frac{x}{2}\right) = 8x-9+8-4x+2x$$
Combine like terms on the right-hand side of the equation: 
$$8x-9+8-4x+2x= \boxed{6x-1}$$
Combine like terms on the right-hand side of the equation: $6x-1$
Combine like terms on the right-hand side of the equation: $$8x-9+8-4x+2x=6x-1$$
Distribute the 3/2 to the terms inside the first parentheses, and distribute the −4 to the terms inside the second parentheses: 
(2x)+(3/2) (4x-6)−4(−(2-x)+(x/2)) 
= (2x)+(3/2)(4x-6)−4(−2+x−(x/2)) 
= (2x)+(6x−9)−4(−2+x−(x/2))
Simplify the expression inside the second parentheses by distributing the -4 and combining like terms, and also combine like terms in the expression inside the first parentheses: 
(2x)+(6x−9)−4(−2+x−(x/2)) 
= (2x)+(6x−9)+8−4x+2x
Combine like terms on the right-hand side of the equation: $8x-9+8-4x+2x=6x-1$
Combine like terms on the right-hand side of the equation: 8x - 9 + 8 - 4x + 2x = 6x - 1
Distribute the $\frac{3}{2}$ to the terms inside the first parentheses, and distribute the $-4$ to the terms inside the second parentheses: $$\left(2x+\frac{3}{2} (4x-6)\right)-4\left( -(2-x)+\frac{x}{2}\right) = \left(2x+6x-9\right)-4\left(-2+x-\frac{x}{2}\right)$$

Step 2: Simplify the expression inside the second parentheses by distributing the $-4$ and combining like terms, and also combine like terms in the expression inside the first parentheses: $$\left(2x+6x-9\right)-4\left(-2+x-\frac{x}{2}\right) = 8x-9+8-4x+2x$$

= (2x)+(3/2)(4x-6)−4(−2+x−(x/2)) 
= (2x)+(6x−9)−4(−2+x−(x/2))

Simplify the expression inside the second parentheses by distributing the -4 and combining like terms, and also combine like terms in the expression inside the first parentheses: 
(2x)+(6x−9)−4(−2+x−(x/2)) 
= (2x)+(6x−9)+8−4x+2x
Combine like terms on the right-hand side of the equation: $8x-9+8-4x+2x=6x-1$
Combine like terms on the right-hand side of the equation: 8x - 9 + 8 - 4x + 2x = 6x - 1
